question: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s
api_result: The open-source clone of Unix created in the early 1990s that you are referring to is likely "Linux." Linux was developed by Linus Torvalds and released in 1991. It was designed to be a free and open-source alternative to the Unix operating system and is based on the Unix architecture and principles. Linux has since grown to become one of the most popular and widely used operating systems in the world, especially in server and supercomputing environments.
